attributes.comment:
As a concerned citizen and interested adopter, I must write in on this proposed fee
increase.
I understand as a business person that fees must be updated to reflect the current
day costs of making business happen. At the same time, if I were to implement up
to a 66% increase in my fees for services, I would go out of business because my
customers would go somewhere else.
Perhaps we need to evaluate this case in the same way. There are many families
in the US that are excited about adopting domestically or internationally but a
huge roadblock is in front of them when they learn about the costs. Children all
over the country and the world need a home, a family and a chance at life. We are
prepared to give it to them but the cost is becoming increasingly burdensome to
the point of crushing the hopes and dreams of families being created in our
blessed country.
I ask that you reconsider these fee increases from both a logical and a caring
perspective. Must we increase the fees and set up more roadblocks for adoption?
What if it was you waiting for a home or a family or a chance at life? What if you
never were chosen? Not because of your worth but because it just couldn't be
afforded?

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Esther W.
